required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: PT001 MDI Versus Atrovent Study in Moderate to Severe Chronic Obstructive Pulmonary Disease (COPD)
clinical_study.official_title: A Randomized, Double-Blind, Chronic Dosing (7 Days), Three-Period, Six-Treatment, Placebo-Controlled, Incomplete Block, Cross-Over, Multi-Center Study to Assess Efficacy and Safety of Four Doses of PT001 in Patients With Moderate to Severe COPD, Compared With Atrovent® HFA Inhalation Aerosol (Open-Label) as An Active Control

brief_summary.textblock: The overall objective of this study is to determine an optimal dose and dosing regimen of PT001 MDI for further evaluation in later stage studies.

detailed_description.textblock: The primary objective of this study is to demonstrate efficacy relative to placebo of PT001 MDI in patients with moderate to severe chronic obstructive pulmonary disease (COPD) within the range of doses evaluated in this protocol. To this end, each dose of PT001 MDI will be compared to placebo with respect to the primary efficacy endpoint, FEV1 AUC0-12 relative to baseline.

study_design_info.masking: Quadruple (Participant, Care Provider, Investigator, Outcomes Assessor)

primary_outcome.time_frame: Day 7 ( -1 hour, -30 min, 15 min, 30 min, 1 hour, 2 hours, 4 hours, 5.5 hours, 6.5 hours, 8 hours, 10 hours, 11.5 hours, and 12 hours)
primary_outcome.description: FEV1 AUC0-12 following chronic dosing (1 week), normalized.

secondary_outcome.measure: Peak Change From Baseline in FEV1 on Day 1
secondary_outcome.description: Highest value of FEV1 post-dose minus baseline on Day 1 (baseline-adjusted)

secondary_outcome.measure: Time to Onset of Action ( ≥10% Improvement in FEV1) on Day 1
secondary_outcome.description: Time to onset of action ( ≥10% improvement in FEV1)

secondary_outcome.measure: Proportion of Subjects Achieving at Least 12% Improvement in FEV1 on Day 1
secondary_outcome.description: Proportion of subjects achieving at least 12% improvement in FEV1 (relative to baseline)

secondary_outcome.measure: Peak Change From Baseline in IC on Day 1
secondary_outcome.description: Peak change from baseline in Inspiratory Capacity (IC) on Day 1 (mean of 1 and 2 hours post-dose minus baseline on Day 1)

secondary_outcome.measure: Change From Baseline in Morning Pre-dose FEV1 on Day 7
secondary_outcome.description: Change from baseline in morning pre-dose FEV1

secondary_outcome.measure: Peak Change From Baseline in FEV1 on Day 7
secondary_outcome.description: Peak change from baseline in FEV1

secondary_outcome.measure: Peak Change From Baseline in IC on Day 7
secondary_outcome.description: Peak change from baseline in IC

secondary_outcome.measure: Change From Baseline in 12-hour Post-dose Trough FEV1 on Day 7
secondary_outcome.description: Change from baseline in 12-hour post-dose trough FEV1

intervention.description: PT001 MDI administered as two puffs BID for 7 days
Taken as 2 inhalations of the 17 µg per actuation strength MDI QID
Matching placebo to PT001 MDI administered as two puffs BID for 7 days

criteria.textblock:
Key Inclusion Criteria:
- Signed written informed consent
- 40 - 80 years of age
- Clinical history of COPD with airflow limitation that is not fully reversible
- Females of non-child bearing potential or females of child bearing potential with negative pregnancy test; and acceptable contraceptive methods
- Current/former smokers with at least a 10 pack-year history of cigarette smoking
- A measured post- bronchodilator FEV1/FVC ratio of < or = 0.70
- A measured post- bronchodilator FEV1 > or = 750ml or 30% predicted and < or = 80% of predicted normal values
- Able to change COPD treatment as required by protocol
Key Exclusion Criteria:
- Women who are pregnant or lactating
- Primary diagnosis of asthma
- Alpha-1 antitrypsin deficiency as the cause of COPD
- Active pulmonary diseases
- Prior lung volume reduction surgery
- Abnormal chest X-ray (or CT scan) not due to the presence of COPD
- Hospitalized due to poorly controlled COPD within 3 months of Screening
- Clinically significant medical conditions that preclude participation in the study (e.g. clinically significant abnormal ECG, uncontrolled hypertension, glaucoma, symptomatic prostatic hypertrophy)
- Cancer that has not been in complete remission for at least 5 years
- Treatment with investigational study drug or participation in another clinical trial or study within the last 30 days or 5 half lives
Other inclusion/exclusion criteria as defined in the protocol

participant_flow.recruitment_details: Conducted at 9 US sites from May-October 2011. Entire period of study participation per subject was a maximum of 15 weeks. Planned target enrollment of 84 subjects.
participant_flow.pre_assignment_details: This was a chronic dosing study (7 days), 3-period, 6-treatment, incomplete block, crossover study. Each subject received 3 of 6 possible treatments; each treatment period was separated by a washout period 7-28 days. By-treatment sequence tabulations of the data were not pre-specified.

baseline.population: Intent-to-Treat (ITT) Population includes all subjects who were randomized, received at least 1 dose of study treatment, and had both baseline and post-baseline efficacy data for that treatment.

group.title: ITT Population
group.description: ITT Population includes all subjects who were randomized, received at least 1 dose of study treatment, and had both baseline and post-baseline efficacy data for that treatment.

outcome.title: FEV1 AUC0-12
outcome.description: FEV1 AUC0-12 following chronic dosing (1 week), normalized.
outcome.time_frame: Day 7 ( -1 hour, -30 min, 15 min, 30 min, 1 hour, 2 hours, 4 hours, 5.5 hours, 6.5 hours, 8 hours, 10 hours, 11.5 hours, and 12 hours)
outcome.population: Modified Intent to Treat (MITT) Population includes subjects who completed at least 2 treatment periods, with minimally 1 pre-dose assessment on Day 7 for each of those 2 treatment periods with no protocol deviations believed to have a potential impact on efficacy results.

group.title: Ipratropium Bromide HFA Inhalation Aerosol
group.description: Ipratropium Bromide HFA Inhalation Aerosol 34 µg QID.

reported_events.time_frame: Adverse events were collected from the time the subject signed consent up to the follow-up phone call 7-14 days after last dose of study drug.
reported_events.desc: Safety population included all participants who received at least one dose of investigational drug and had safety data available; participants were included in safety population according to the investigational drug received

group.title: Ipratropium Bromide HFA Inhalation Aerosol
group.description: Ipratropium Bromide HFA Inhalation Aerosol 34 µg QID.

certain_agreements.pi_employee: Principal Investigators are NOT employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: Drafts of any and all publications or presentations of this study must be submitted at least 30 days prior to submission for publication or presentation to Pearl Therapeutics for review, approval, and to ensure consistency. Pearl Therapeutics has the right to request appropriate modification to correct facts and to represent its opinions, or the opinions of the publication committee, if these differ with the proposed publication.
